msContents.summary: Both sides of the largest fragment come from a legal document

msItem.note: A box of many fragments in papyrus and paper, comprising Arabic, Greek, Coptic and Hieratic pieces; all need lots of conservation

Two scraps of paper from the same document with Arabic writing on both sides and in the right margin; they need to be flattened out and assembled; also one scrap of papyrus that has a few Arabic letters on it with other language on back. These are the only fragments with Arabic in the box. Fragment 687c seems to come from a Greek document but only a few letters are visible
In the largest fragment on one side 3 lines of writing; in the other 3 more. There are dots differentiating some letters

physDesc.p: Papyrus and paper fragments ; 13.5 x 3 cm. (the largest)

provenance.p: Purchased by Prof. Jeffery in Egypt in 1946, lot. no. 5
